name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: We’ve all been desperately trying to read Trump’s tea leaves. His type of tea? Insana.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Two weeks’ notice is so important, because Trump knows starting a war in the Middle East is a lot like quitting your sales job at Best Buy. It’s just polite.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: The solstice normally falls on the 21st, but this year, the longest day… has been every day.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The White House said Trump will make a decision on the U.S. involvement in Iran within the next two weeks. If Trump thinks about this decision for two weeks, it’ll beat his previous thinking record by two weeks.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The heat is already brutal. Today on my way into work, I was sweating like Ted Cruz being asked about Iran.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The first day of summer is also the longest day of the year. Although, just about every day since the inauguration has felt like the longest day of the year, hasn’t it?

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The L.A. Lakers have been sold for a record $10 billion. Meanwhile, the Utah Jazz are on eBay and nobody’s bid anything.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Trader Joe’s just opened a new store in California that is directly across from an existing Trader Joe’s. Customers love it, while stoned cashiers have never been more confused.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Two weeks. It’s always two weeks. For a guy whose catchphrase is ‘You’re fired,’ no one has ever given more two weeks’ notice than Donald J. Trump.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: According to the White House, all options remain on the table for the president, specifically McDonald’s, Popeyes, Domino’s, and KFC.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Scientists at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Climate Prediction Center are warning that this summer is forecast to be unusually hot, so, they’re all fired.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Tomorrow, in case you didn’t know, is the first official day of summer. June 20th, the summer solstice, used to be the longest day of the year, but that’s one of the nice things about Trump being president — now every day is the longest day of the year.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I don’t want to go, either, they put it in my contract, I have to go to fat camp every summer.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I’m going to spend the bulk of my summer at the Newark Airport this year.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Rest assured that if Donald Trump does anything monumentally crazy, anything that requires an emergency response, I will be in a canoe ignoring it.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: [The Buss family] has owned it since 1979 when Dr. Jerry Buss bought the team for $37 and a bag of cocaine.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: half-assed” nickname for his Federal Reserve Chair, Jerome “Too Late

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Trump treats going to war like the rest of us treat company softball. I don’t know, it kind of sounds fun, but I also like having my weekends.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: President Trump held a ceremony yesterday at the White House to commemorate the erection of two new flag poles because when you’re 79, every erection is worth celebrating.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: When asked yesterday about the difference between his first and second terms, President Trump said, ‘I was the hunted, and now I’m the hunter.’ Dude, that’s not the job. You’re thinking of the difference between the first and second Rambo .

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Which I assume means he’s also got crazy stuff on his laptop. No, no, not that one. Not that Hunter.
